definitions.definition: ( heading ) To do with a place or places.

subdefinitions.definition: A road , a direction , a (physical or conceptual) path from one place to another.
examples: Do you know the way to the airport? Come this way and I'll show you a shortcut. It's a long way from here.
Twen miles is a long way to walk.

subdefinitions.definition: A means to enter or leave a place.
examples: We got into the cinema through the back way .
If you're ever 'round this way , come over and visit me.

definitions.definition: A method or manner of doing something; a mannerism .
examples: You're going about it the wrong way . He's known for his quirky ways . I don't like the way she looks at me.

subdefinitions.definition: ( with 'the' , usually with modifier ) A set of values and customs associated with and seen as central to the identity of a group of people.

examples: When I returned home, I found my house and belongings in a most terrible way .

subdefinitions.definition: Possibility (usually in the phrases 'any way' and 'no way').
examples: There's no way I'm going to clean up after you.

subdefinitions.definition: Determined course; resolved mode of action or conduct.
examples: My little sister always whines until she gets her way .

definitions.definition: ( Germanic paganism ) A tradition within the modern pagan faith of Heathenry , dedication to a specific deity or craft, Way of wyrd , Way of runes , Way of Thor etc.
A degree, an amount, a sense.
examples: In a significant way , crocodiles and alligators are similar.

definitions.definition: ( US , As the head of an interjectory clause, followed by an infinitive starting with “to” ) Acknowledges that a task has been done well, chiefly in expressions of sarcastic congratulation.
examples: Way to ruin the moment, guys.

definitions.definition: ( plural only ) The timbers of shipyard stocks that slope into the water and along which a ship or large boat is launched .
( usually plural ) A guiding surface on the bed of a planer , lathe , etc. along which a table or carriage moves; usually in pairs.

main_definition: ( heading ) To do with a place or places.
secondary_definitions: A method or manner of doing something; a mannerism .
( Germanic paganism ) A tradition within the modern pagan faith of Heathenry , dedication to a specific deity or craft, Way of wyrd , Way of runes , Way of Thor etc.
A degree, an amount, a sense.
( US , As the head of an interjectory clause, followed by an infinitive starting with “to” ) Acknowledges that a task has been done well, chiefly in expressions of sarcastic congratulation.
( plural only ) The timbers of shipyard stocks that slope into the water and along which a ship or large boat is launched .
( usually plural ) A guiding surface on the bed of a planer , lathe , etc. along which a table or carriage moves; usually in pairs.

definitions.definition: ( glassblowing , obsolete ) A seventeenth-century unit of Rhenish glass containing 60 bunches .

main_definition: ( glassblowing , obsolete ) A seventeenth-century unit of Rhenish glass containing 60 bunches .

definitions.definition: The letter for the w sound in Pitman shorthand .

main_definition: The letter for the w sound in Pitman shorthand .
